H0.text: Carbon is the element whose compounds form the basis of all known life.

H1.text: Oxygen is the element in compounds that form the basis of all known life.

H2.text: Helium is the element whose compounds form the basis of all known life.

H3.text: Hydrogen is the element whose compounds form the basis of all known life.

A4.text: Organic chemistry is a subdiscipline within chemistry involving the scientific study of the structure, properties, and reactions of organic compounds and organic materials, i.e., matter in its various forms that contain carbon atoms.

A5.text: Organic compounds form the basis of all earthly life and constitute the majority of known chemicals.
